text:
Curious Glances

A dim, cluttered room; Raskolnikov feels uneasy.  
Raskolnikov: “Such cleanliness... why is she so suspicious?”  

---

The old woman enters, arms crossed, glaring.  
Old Woman: “What do you want?”  
Raskolnikov: “I’ve brought something to pawn.”  

---

He reveals an old silver watch, anxious.  
Raskolnikov: “How much will you give me?”  
Old Woman: “A rouble and a half!”  

---

Raskolnikov frowns, frustration boiling.  
Raskolnikov: “Four roubles! It was my father’s!”  
Old Woman: “Please yourself.”

**PAGE SUMMARY:** Raskolnikov attempts to pawn a silver watch but is met with the old woman's harsh refusal and undervaluation of his item.
